summary: Food ordering app with comprehensive category system (fast food, breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, vegetarian, non-vegetarian, healthy foods) and Amazon-style e-commerce features including product listings, shopping cart, user accounts, and order management
architectural_notes: E-commerce architecture similar to Amazon with product catalog, cart, and checkout flow
Internet Identity integration for user authentication
known_issues: No food items displaying on the frontend despite being added to backend database

existing_features.title: Create frontend home page with category browsing section displaying all 8 food categories (fast food, breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, vegetarian, non-vegetarian, healthy foods) as clickable cards with representative imagery
Build product listing page that displays food items in grid layout with item cards showing image, name, price, category badge, and 'Add to Cart' button, with filtering by category
Create shopping cart page showing cart items with thumbnails, names, quantities with increment/decrement controls, individual prices, subtotal, and checkout button
Implement Internet Identity authentication with login/logout functionality and user session management
Create order history page displaying user's past orders with order ID, date, items ordered, total amount, and current status with visual status indicators

Design and implement a cohesive visual theme with warm, appetizing colors (oranges, greens, warm neutrals) inspired by modern food delivery platforms, using clean typography and inviting imagery throughout the interface
Render generated category images and food placeholder images as static assets in frontend/public/assets/generated directory

Debug and fix the food items query in the ProductsPage component to ensure the five seeded food items (Chicken Biryani, Paneer Tikka, Aloo Paratha, Matar Paneer, Matar Paneer Roti) are retrieved from the backend and displayed in the product grid
Verify the useQueries hook's getAllFoodItems query is correctly configured to fetch data from the backend actor and handle loading/error states appropriately
Check the InitializeData component execution to confirm that all five food items are successfully seeded on admin login and verify no duplicate prevention logic is blocking legitimate items

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement food category system with fast food, breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, vegetarian, non-vegetarian, and healthy food categories
Create product listing pages with food items and details
Add user account system with Internet Identity authentication

Create backend data model for food items with fields: id, name, description, price, category (fast food, breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, vegetarian, non-vegetarian, healthy foods), imageUrl, availability status, and preparation time
Implement backend functions to add, update, delete, and retrieve food items with filtering by category
Create shopping cart data structure and backend functions to add items, update quantities, remove items, and calculate total price per user

Implement order management system with backend functions to create orders from cart, store order history with status tracking (pending, confirmed, preparing, delivered), and retrieve user order history

Add initial food items to database: Chicken Biryani (₹180, Lunch/Non-Vegetarian), Paneer Tikka (₹150, Dinner/Vegetarian), Aloo Paratha (₹80, Breakfast/Vegetarian), Matar Paneer (₹150, Dinner/Vegetarian), Matar Paneer Roti (₹200, Dinner or Lunch/Vegetarian)

Add Chicken Biryani food item to backend database with name 'Chicken Biryani', price ₹180, categories 'Lunch' and 'Non-Vegetarian', placeholder image URL, available status, and appropriate description and preparation time

Add Paneer Tikka food item to backend database with name 'Paneer Tikka', price ₹150, categories 'Dinner' and 'Vegetarian', placeholder image URL, available status, and appropriate description and preparation time

Add Aloo Paratha food item to backend database with name 'Aloo Paratha', price ₹80, categories 'Breakfast' and 'Vegetarian', placeholder image URL, available status, and appropriate description and preparation time

Add Matar Paneer food item to backend database with name 'Matar Paneer', price ₹150, categories 'Dinner' and 'Vegetarian', placeholder image URL, available status, and appropriate description and preparation time

Add Matar Paneer Roti food item to backend database with name 'Matar Paneer Roti', price ₹200, categories 'Dinner', 'Lunch', and 'Vegetarian', placeholder image URL, available status, and appropriate description and preparation time

Verify the backend getAllFoodItems function returns the correct data structure that matches the frontend FoodItem type expectations, including all required fields (id, name, description, price, categories array, imageUrl, isAvailable, prepTime)
